page.title: 10INNS NEAR PRIVETT
page.content: A change in life styles over the years is reflected in the change in use of "The Sun", "The Wheatsheaf" and "The Three Horseshoes" - all now private houses. {"The Pig & Whistle"}on the A32 serves the local inhabitants and attracts visitors with its home-brewed beers. Coach parties are catered for in the restaurant and there is a garden with play equipment for children. {"The West Meon Hut"}situated at the busy junction of the A272/A32,provides a welcome halt for holiday traffic. During summer week-ends families fill the roomy terrace with bustle and chatter. The Inn serves coffee and croissants, traditional cream teas, salads, bar and restaurant meals. During the winter months it is a popular lunch stop for shooting parties.
